result.execSummary:
Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Tera M Tillman

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: Original PLEA/SENTENCING HEARING Transcript (31 pages) commencing MAY 16, 2016 received and filed. kl

Defendant Tera M Tillman in court with attorney Paul Garland Bonneson.  Defendant Tera M Tillman in custody.  Tyrone Martin St. Junior appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Pursuant to plea negotations, and on motion of the State, Court ordered case DISMISSED to be used as a READ-IN on case 15CF4830.

Attorney Paul Garland Bonneson in court, defendant Tera M Tillman not in court, in custody.  Jessica Bellows appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk: KAR.
Defendant in custody at HOC not produced, appearance waived.  Case calendared for status conference.  Defendant has pending felonies in Branch 19.  Defense requests scheduling conference date.  State does not object.  Court ordered case adjourned for scheduling conference in Branch 21.  Scheduling conference scheduled for May 16, 2016 at 08:30 am.
Attorney Paul Garland Bonneson requests a new status conference date of 4/22/2016 at 8:30 a.m.

Attorney Paul Garland Bonneson in court, defendant Tera M Tillman not in court, in custody.  Jessica Bellows appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Case in court for status conference. Defense counsel requests more time. Court ordered case adjourned for status conference in Branch 21.  Status conference scheduled for April 15, 2016 at 08:30 am.

Attorney Paul Garland Bonneson in court, defendant Tera M Tillman not in court, in custody.  Margaret Anne Kunisch appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Case in court for plea hearing. Defendant has another case pending 15CF4830. Defense counsel requests a status date for a possible global resolution. Court ordered case adjourned for status conference in Branch 4.  Status conference scheduled for April 13, 2016 at 01:30 pm.

Attorney Paul Garland Bonneson in court, defendant Tera M Tillman not in court, in custody.  Alex T. Mueller appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy court clerk cmt.
Defenant not produced, appearance waived.  Statements by defense counsel that defendant has a pending felony case before Branch 19.  Defense requests a projected guilty plea date.  Case adjourned to Branch 45.  Plea hearing scheduled for February 3, 2016 at 01:30 pm.

Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  Defendant to have no contact with Christine P.
  Court advised defendant that failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.

Defendant Tera M Tillman in court with attorney Melissa Nepomiachi.  Defendant Tera M Tillman in custody.  Brandon A Wigley appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy court clerk:  hgj.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Michelle Ackerman Havas, Branch 45.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause.  Defendant advised of right to counsel and complaint given to defendant's attorney.  Defendant plead not guilty.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND QUALIFIES FOR PUBLIC DEFENDER REPRESENTATION.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for December 4, 2015 at 08:30 am.
COURT ORDERED DEFENDANT REMANDED TO THE COMMISSIONER ON RETURN OF THE ARREST WARRANT.

Defendant Tera M Tillman not in court.  Nicholas Steven Cerwin appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant failing to appear, Court ordered an Arrest Warrant to be issued.  Court ordered any bail posted to be forfeited.  State's motion for Judgment of Bond Forfeiture 30 days after notification from the Clerk of Circuit Court's Office is granted by the Court.  Court makes finding that there is a possible victim identified, therefore, Court stays order of forfeiture with recompense to be determined at close of case.
SUMMONS MAILED. DEFENDANT ORDERED INTO ROOM 221 SAFETY BUILDING ON 8/6/15 @ 1:30 pm
